text: Ibrahim Muhammad Didi (އިބްރާހީމް މުޙައްމަދުދީދީ) (also known as Velaanaagey Ibrahim Didi) was the first Vice President of Maldives. He was acting president from September 2, 1953, to March 7, 1954, after the banishment of Mohamed Amin Didi. He was appointed minister of finance of the Maldives Sultanate from July 1954 to November 1955. ==References== Category:Presidents of the Maldives Category:Vice presidents of the Maldives Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing
title: Ibrahim Muhammad Didi
